articles.title: SPA Hosts Reception for Czech Speaker of Chamber of Deputies
articles.content:
Congratulations to Dominican Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to his Dominican counterpart Roosevelt Skerrit.
 Extending warm congratulations to him upon his assumption of Dominican prime ministership, the message wished him success in his responsible work for the development of the country and improvement of the standard of the people's living.

articles.title: U.S. Human Rights Abuses Assailed
articles.content:
SPA Hosts Reception for Czech Speaker of Chamber of Deputies 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) hosted a reception in honor of Lubomir Zaoralek, speaker of the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic, on a visit to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Saturday evening.
 Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the SPA, in his speech at the reception said that his visit would make a great contribution to putting the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the Czech Republic on a fresh higher stage as required by the new century.    
 Lubomir Zaoralek in his speech said it is important to develop the friendly relations between the two countries as required by the new century and expressed the belief that their visit would contribute to the development of the relations.

articles.title: Fruition of Chinese People's Struggle for Peaceful Reunification�@of Their Country Hailed
U.S. Hit for Its False Propaganda
articles.content:
Fruition of Chinese People's Struggle for Peaceful Reunification�@of Their Country Hailed 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Hu Jintao had official talks with senior most officials of the National Party of China and the People First Party of Taiwan on the issues of peaceful reunification and economic exchange and made public joint communiques during their visits to the mainland of China. They shared understanding of the issues related to the cross- straits relations.
 In this regard Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a signed commentary:    
 This is a natural fruition of the policy pursued by the Communist Party of China for peaceful reunification on the principle of "peaceful reunification, one country and two systems" and a historic event, a result of the protracted arduous struggle of the party and government of China. 
 The above-said party leaders' tours of the mainland constitute response to the sincere will and efforts of the party and the people of China to prevent the permanent division of the country and create an environment favorable for territorial integrity and peaceful reunification.    
 As already reported, the Chinese party and government took important steps to legally guarantee and stipulate the country's reunification and sovereignty and territorial integrity, prevent "Taiwan's independence" and achieve the reunification of the whole country. The "Anti-Cessation Law"
adopted at the Third Session of the Tenth National People's Congress of China is supported and approved by the Chinese at home and abroad as it reflects the unanimous wishes and will of all Chinese people.  The successful visits of the above-said opposition parties of Taiwan to the mainland deal heavy blows at "the pro-Taiwan independence" forces who pursue cessation and work hard to break the cross-straits ties, fanning up enmity towards the mainland and at the foreign forces who have unreasonably interfered in the internal affairs of China. These positive results go to prove the unshakable stand and will of the Chinese party and government to promote the peaceful reunification of the country and achieve the stability and progress of the cross-straits relations and will encourage the Chinese people in their struggle for the peaceful reunification in the days ahead.

articles.title: DPRK FM Sends Congratulations to His U.K. Counterpart
DPRK to Continue Following U.S. Attitude
articles.content:
DPRK FM Sends Congratulations to His U.K. Counterpart 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to his counterpart Jack Straw of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
 The message extended congratulations to him upon his reappointment as secretary for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs of the U.K.

articles.title: List of Victims of Forcible Conscription into Imperial Japanese�@Army Disclosed
True Story about U.S. Touted "Strategic Flexibility" Revealed
articles.content:
List of Victims of Forcible Conscription into Imperial Japanese�@Army Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A new list of the Koreans who died during the Pacific War after being forcibly conscripted into the imperial Japanese army was disclosed by a religious man in Ryosu City, South Jolla Province, according to the south Korean MBC.
 The list was reportedly worked out by the Supporting Bureau of the Japanese Ministry of Health in 1955. It refers in detail to the identities of 2,331 Koreans who fell in the Pacific War and the dates of their death. Among them were 201 Korean women.    
 This fact is triggering off bitterer resentment among the south Korean people as it was disclosed at a time when Japan is becoming more undisguised in its brazen-faced distortion of history.

articles.content:
Greetings to Yemeni President
    Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh on Saturday on the occasion of the 15th national day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Yemen greater successes in their work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Czech Republic Held
articles.content:
Czech Speaker of Chamber of Deputies Arrives
    Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic Lubomir Zaoralek arrived here today to visit the DPRK on the invitation of its Supreme People's Assembly.
 He was accompanied by Deputy Speaker Ivan Langer, deputies and other suite members.    
 The speaker was greeted at the airport by Kang Nung Su, vice-chairman of the SPA, other officials concerned and Czech Charge d'Affaires here Miroslav Podhajsky.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Guinean President Arrives
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Czech Republic Held
    Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Lubomir Zaoralek, speaker of the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on May 21.
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two law-making bodies and a series of issues of common concern.    
 Present there from the DPRK side were Kang Nung Su, vice-chairman of the SPA, Hong So Hon and Kim Kwang Chol, deputies to the SPA, and officials concerned and from the Czech side Ivan Langer, deputy speaker of the Chamber of Deputies, Members of the Chamber of Deputies Vladimir Lastuvka, Pavel Kovacik, Michaela Sojdrova and Pavel Svoboda, and Miroslav Podhajsky, charge d'affaires of the Czech embassy here, and others.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Guinean President Calls on Paek Nam Sun
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Guinean President Arrives
    Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Facine Toure, special envoy of the Guinean president, and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and officials concerned.
